question: When did the United Empire Loyalists come to Canada?
main_question: When did the United Empire Loyalists come to Canada?
explanatory_sentence: In 1776, the 13 British colonies to the south of Quebec declared independence and formed the United States. North America was again divided by war. More than 40,000 people loyal to the Crown, called 'Loyalists,' fled the oppression of the American Revolution to settle in Nova Scotia and Quebec.
